required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of C-MAC Video-stylet Versus C-MAC D- Blade Video-laryngoscope for Tracheal Intubation
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of C-MAC Video-stylet Versus C-MAC D- Blade Video-laryngoscope for Tracheal Intubation in Patients With Predicted Difficult Airway: Randomized Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: Videolaryngoscopy provides a better laryngeal view and do not need airway alignment for tracheal intubation.

detailed_description.textblock: The C-MAC-VS can be connected easily to the same C- MAC monitor and Pocket Monitor without requiring any additional light source and camera. This device is great for cases with limited mouth opening, airway obstruction and difficult intubation. C-MAC-VS has no lumens so it's very easy to clean and it can accommodates a size ETT 6.0 and greater.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The patients will be randomly assigned into two equal groups using computer-generated randomization technique. Group C-MAC VS (VS group) included patients undergoing tracheal intubation using the C-MAC VS. Group C-MAC VL D -blade (D group) included patients undergoing intubation using the C-MAC VL D-blade.

primary_outcome.description: assess duration of intubation procedure by using C-MAC VS versus C-MAC D-blade in patients with anticipated difficult airway.

arm_group.description: patients undergoing tracheal intubation using the C-MAC VS.
patients undergoing intubation using the C-MAC VL D-blade.

intervention.description: patients undergoing tracheal intubation using the C-MAC VS
patients undergoing intubation using the C-MAC VL D-blade.
